father.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Ask your father to help you.
Andrew was very excited about becoming a father.
He’s been like a father to me.
Steve recently became the proud father of a 7lb 12oz baby girl.
The driver, a father of four, escaped uninjured.
father.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: father
a male parent
My father’s a doctor.
He’s a father of three.
dad
used when talking to your father, or about someone’s father
Can I borrow your car, Dad?
Her dad retired ten years ago.
My dad was in the army.
daddy
a name for father, which is used especially by young children or when you are talking to young children
Where’s your daddy?
Daddy, can I have a drink, please?
pop
used when talking to your father, or about someone’s father
I helped Pop fix the gate this morning.
Can I help, Pa?
He is in New York with his Pop’s credit card, eating all the ice cream and pizza the city has to offer.
papa
used when talking to your father, or about someone’s father
Papa had forbidden me to go.
She saw her papa’s face change at this news.
somebody’s old man
someone’s father – used when talking about him in a way that is not very respectful
His old man wouldn’t let him use the car.
stepfather
a man who is married to your mother, who is not your father but often acts as your parent
Her stepfather is really nice.
father.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a priest, especially in the Roman Catholic Church
father.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a way of talking to or talking about God, used in the Christian religion
father.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to become the father of a child by making a woman pregnant
father.translation[3].definitions[1].def: to start an important new idea or system
father.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: Bevan fathered the concept of the National Health Service.
